metadata.title: Wednesday, 19th February, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs
parts: (a) where, on the 1958 map, the official boundary between Chief Simwatachela and Chief Sipatunyana in Mapatizya Parliamentary Constituency lies; and
(b) in which chiefdom Kasikili Primary School is located.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a) why the pontoon at Libonda in Liuwa Parliamentary Constituency has not been repaired for more than two years;
(b) whether the pontoon service has been withdrawn;
(c) if not, when the service will resume; and
(d) when the damaged pontoon at Kalabo will be replaced with a modern one.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock whether the Government has any plans to present the following Bills to Parliament for enactment
parts: (a) the Agriculture Marketing Bill; and
(b) the Commodity Exchange Bill.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education what the teacher-pupil ratio at the following schools in Solwezi West Parliamentary Constituency was, as of October, 2013
parts: (a) Mutanda High;
(b) Jihundu High;
(c) Meheba High;
(d) Manyawa Basic;
(e) Chovwe Basic; and
(f) Mwajimambwe Basic.
(a) how many urologists were at the University Teaching Hospital as of December, 2013;
(b) whether the Government has any plans to have a urologist at every district hospital, country-wide; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) what measures the Government has taken to ensure that the Food Reserve Agency (FRA) pays farmers promptly for the supplied produce; and
(b) when the Government, through the FRA, will increase the price of a 50kg bag of maize from the current K65.
(a) what the total value of X-ray machines at the University Teaching Hospital (UTH) was as of December, 2013;
(b) whether the Government has any plans to procure new machines for the UTH;
(c) if so, what the estimated cost of the equipment is; and
(d) whether the company to supply the equipment has already been identified and, if so, what the name of the company is.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a) how much money ZESCO Limited paid to the Zambezi River Authority as levies from 2011 to 2013, year by year;
(b) how much money the Authority spent on corporate social responsibility activities to communities along the Zambezi River in the same period; and
(c) if no money was spent on corporate social responsibility,why.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a) how many juveniles are currently in reformatory schools, country-wide;
(b) what the most prevalent offences committed by the juveniles are; and
(c) what programmes are undertaken in the reformatory schools to reform the juveniles.
(a) when Frequency Modulation radio transmitters will be installed in Luwingu District; and
(b) when the ZNBC television signal will be improved in the District.
(a) how the Football Association of Zambia will use the US$125,000 that was donated by the Confederation of African Football in 2013;
(b) whether football clubs in rural areas will also benefit from the donation and, if so, how; and
(c) how the funds will improve the football sport in general, country-wide. ORDER OF THE DAY 1. The Business Regulatory Bill     (N.A.B. 22/2013) Second Reading
